metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5589 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The phar_convert_to_other function in ext/phar/phar_object.c in PHP before5.4.43, 5.5.x before 5.5.27, and 5.6.x before 5.6.11 does not validate afile pointer before a close operation, which allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (segmentation fault) or possibly have unspecifiedother impact via a crafted TAR archive that is mishandled in aPhar::convertToData call.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5589` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-cgi - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-cli - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-common - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-curl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-enchant - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-fpm - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13

php5-intl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-ldap - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-mysql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-mysqlnd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-odbc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-pgsql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-pspell - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-readline - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-recode - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-snmp - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-sqlite - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-sybase - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-tidy - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-xmlrpc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
php5-xsl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.13').
